intro: Calibrachoa eglandulata, commonly known as the silverleaf calibrachoa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes and potatoes. This species is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers and hairy, silver-green foliage. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for container gardening. The plant is known for its compact growth habit and ability to bloom profusely throughout the growing season.
